Comments_List: I learned how to better communicate my science!
Where to find information and where to turn if there are concerns about ethical infractions. Good overview of guidelines, documentation, and trainings that are in place.
I learned a lot of knowledge about various bioethics issues. I practiced how to introduce a topic and lead a discussion and came up with different activities to keep everyone engaged.
In bioethics, I learned about peer review, grant writing, neuroscience in law, policies governing animal and human research, diversity in science, as well as a host of other topics.
This course was amazing. I loved that every week different students and faculty led the discussions and that the formats tended to be fairly proactive.
Strengths: discussion style, group assignments, readings and discussion questions

Strengths: Student-lead discussions, creativity
Weakness: N/A
Absolutely! It was a very engaging course
Yes. It's good to be aware and to think about the ethical questions brought up in the class.
Yes! This class is a great class to learn about the ethics of neuroscience. I believe next year they should implement a class on implicit bias or racism/sexism in general.
